summary_short: A dystopian tale of total surveillance, propaganda, and control.
summary_long: George Orwell's '1984' portrays a totalitarian regime that weaponizes surveillance, propaganda, and language. Winston Smith questions the official narrative; his search for truth collides with the state's machinery of control.

title: The Hobbit
summary_short: A reluctant hobbit joins a quest to reclaim dwarven treasure guarded by a dragon.
summary_long: Bilbo Baggins is thrust into adventure with dwarves to reclaim Erebor from Smaug. On the road, Bilbo discovers courage and cleverness while forging friendships.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
summary_short: A child's-eye view of racial injustice in the American South.
summary_long: Scout Finch narrates as her father Atticus defends a Black man unjustly accused. Themes of empathy, moral courage, and loss of innocence run throughout.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
summary_short: A quest to destroy the One Ring; fellowship, sacrifice, and the pull of darkness.
summary_long: A disparate fellowship undertakes a quest to destroy the One Ring before darkness consumes Middle‑earth. Loyalty, sacrifice, and the seduction of power drive this epic.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
summary_short: An orphan discovers he is a wizard and finds belonging at Hogwarts.
summary_long: The first HP book introduces a world of magic, friendship, and moral choices as Harry confronts the shadow of Voldemort.

title: The Great Gatsby
summary_short: A glittering Jazz Age tragedy about longing and reinvention.
summary_long: Through Nick Carraway's eyes, Fitzgerald explores longing, illusion, and the hollowness beneath wealth in Gatsby's pursuit of Daisy.

title: The Book Thief
summary_short: Narrated by Death, a German girl steals books and hope during WWII.
summary_long: Liesel Meminger steals books and shares them with neighbors and a hidden Jewish refugee, showing resilience in brutal times.

title: The Kite Runner
summary_short: A story of betrayal and redemption spanning Kabul to the US.
summary_long: Amir and Hassan grow up in 1970s Kabul. A moment of betrayal haunts Amir into adulthood and drives a difficult path to redemption.

title: The Name of the Wind
summary_short: Kvothe recounts his path from gifted child to legendary arcanist.
summary_long: Kvothe, a gifted musician and arcanist, recounts his life—from traveling troupe to university—building a hero's myth.

title: All the Light We Cannot See
summary_short: A blind French girl and a German boy cross paths in WWII.
summary_long: Parallel lives converge in occupied France in a luminous story about beauty, survival, and moral complexity.
